title: Kha'Zix is a liability
body:
"At the current state of the game though I'm very scared if they do pick up Kha'Zix, he's fairly squishy, and if they **don't** get going early, he's more of a liability in the current state of the game." -Kobe during picks and bans of TiP vs WFX,  Week 4 day 1

So, I know everyone probably still has nightmares about Kha'Zix being [s]marginally overtuned[/s] at various points in the history of this fine game, but does no one else agree that Kha'Zix is no longer that big problem, and is fairly weak these days?  I mean, even if we just revert the cooldown nerf on his void spikes it would allow him to sustain through the jungle better and be able to get off half-decent ganks, that'd be great news for the bug.

So do you guys still hate kha'zix and think he should never be buffed, or do people agree he could use a bit of help?

replies.body: He's one of the champion who will always be too weak or too strong, never actually balanced.

> [{quoted}](name=Just In Heim,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9iEfhAEB,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-17T17:27:08.067+0000)
>
> He's one of the champion who will always be too weak or too strong, never actually balanced.

I'm confused, is their any part of his kit that Riot doesn't think is a problem? They Reduce the Value of his Q  and nerf the Isolation bonus. Then people found a method for his using his Void Spikes for poke and heal. And Riot said that's cancer too.

Yeah their context for nerfing his poke seemed really strange to me. They said it was bad b/c he could poke indefinitely with no threat of retalliation, but unless you were an adc without a single defensive item, the void spikes would as likely burn up kha's mana pool before killing the target, meanwhile {{champion:76}} can only be caught by a full mana {{champion:38}} and her poke is actually ridiculously potent.

Not to mention Kha'Zix poke range wasn't exceptional. Any other decent poke champions could trade shots from that range, so I never understood what the problem was there.

Back when his evolved W proc'd his passive Kha's poke was just downright ridiculous

The reason he got nerfed is because his poke was AoE, slowed enemies, dealt two types of damage AND was on a champion who could go in, delete an enemy and go out with both jumps and stealth

He was utterly broken

That being said, yeah nowadays? He could use a buff or two
They are talking about his more recent w nerfs. The ones that happened many patches after the patch that made it not proc his passive.

Perhaps Nidalee is replacing him?  They're both assassins, both have poke, sustain, heavy burst, mobility resets, etc.  Except Nid is also ranged, has an attack speed buff, better poke, doesn't rely on isolation, and a bunch of other things too.  The only thing Kha'Zix has that Nid does not is stealth.
I dunno, nidalee has the stealth of extreme range, and that can't be countered by true sight :O

his kit is as loaded with stuff as lee's mainly because of evolutions, they were supposed to make him adapt to fight diferent stuff 

but unlike lee he got nerfed for being good at everything so he is borderline usefull
See, now that just sounds like a challenge.
Yea cuz it's riot doing the blancing, and their balance team of monkey's high on crack.

so i play a lot of kha'zix and i know what you mean, but kha'zix has an issue where if he's ever buffedto have high numbers he completely takes control of the game because of how flexible and verseatile he is (its core to him, its the evolve mechanic adding extra utility to his abilities) 

i love the bug to death but i don't want him buffed, then he'd just be too strong, from my time playing kha'zix in season 5 the thing i have the most trouble with is keeping up with the rest of the game safely, he has plenty of chase potential in ganks but no actual hard CC, so being really squishy means he either has to have great timing and go in for a cleanup or bait his allies into tanking enemy abilities so he can jump in, the jungle just beats his ass too much so he can't keep up with the laners considering how many pots you have to buy to stay in the jungle.

if he's ever buffed he'll be too strong, the cost he pays for all his extra utility (strong AOE slow, reset potential, etc.) is his damage potential being strongest when his opponent is isolated (meaning his Q has less to do with kha'zix skill and more to do with his opponents misplay) thats why they nerfed his W so much, because levels 1-7 maxing W would offer you similar (less) damage to Q but it'd also offer you a strong slow, sustain, and less risk then going into melee Q range. 

kha'zix is a good champion right now honestly, just the jungle doesn't favor him, he's really missing the spirit stone.

Yeah, I think to me, even when Kha'Zix was being played a lot late in season 4, I disliked his state of balance, b/c it was largely about his utility with the damage being an added bonus, where I've always liked to play him as a straight up assassin if possible.

But now with the jungle getting changed and kha'zix getting the w cd nerf, I think it would be pretty reasonable to give him back a tiny bit of sustain or.. something.  I think it would be pretty safe to give him something like that without making him overbearing.

literally all they would have to do is buff the heal on his W at early levels but even out to live values at max rank, it'd help his sustain and encourage maxing Q (like riot wants) since you're technically getting less with putting points in his W.

what do you usually evolve 1st? i used to evolve my E 1st but i've been evolving my Q as of late just so i can be solo dragon at a relatively quick speed

Honestly, I haven't played him a lot this season, been getting a high on playing tanks to much, but my most recent builds have been a tad varied.  I really enjoy evolving q if I think I can get away with it, but I'll evolve w or e for ganks depending on how much lockdown is needed against the opposing lanes.

And yeah, the heal buff would be a godsend, like, I can take 4 camps with kha'zix, but I'll be low enough for an invading jungle ashe to kill me.

ALL HE NEEDS.

Is his isolation range nerf reverted

I still play him with the w route, go trailblazer first until i can upgrade to warriors enchant with stalkers, tear into last whisper/hydra/black cleaver/normally tabis or mercs. You could max w and evolve q for pick teams/objective control, or max and evolve w for farming/better ganks/more of a poke/siege team. I find him to be okay I guess, right now, it just took me a few games to find a good jungle path. Now I can clear one side of my jungle, scuttle, and my other buff, and gank or back.

TL;DR - Personal opinion and build wise, I find him to be okay, except for that one nerf on void cd, but he's still fine otherwise.

Hmm, I can definitely clear somewhat decently, just not without getting pretty low, but to me he feels particularly under-tuned for the majority of mid-late game action **unless** he finds him self in exceptionally perfect circumstances, and can find isolated targets.  Do you feel like you are still able to find success in mid-late game scenarios?

Normally I do quite fine, I try to find some targets, but I normally stick around my team and just try to w poke and catch someone like that. Then I hope we can get dragon/baron/buffs/tower. Then rinse and repeat. If anything I'd swap BC and another item for some tanky stats if you just can't find someone or just cant survive even with resets(GA is good here).

Yeah, I mean I'd say that's how my successful games go for me, but I often get the feeling on Kha'Zix that if I have a good scoreline, it's b/c the rest of my team was already going to be doing well, and I was just in the right place to be able to make sure no one could escape and add a bit more team-wide slow's and threat.

When I am on a losing team with Kha'Zix though, I feel the pressure so much harder than with most other champions.  When I don't have the luxury to let my team do the heavy work before I clean up, it feels like I just w poke a few times while my team gets smashed before I leap away and farm a camp and wait on respawns.

Maybe it's just my mmr, but I do get the feeling that Kha'Zix is more of a snowbally champ in a way, except you snowball off the team's successes.

He is snowbally, but he's nowhere near as feast-or-famine as Aatrox is. Ive been able to find some picks on my own, or actually make an effort on my own, but I also do counterganks on top of normal ganks, plus you could do weirder gank routes, etc. You could look up some NB3 guides off of youtube to see if there's anything to help you in certain situations, hopefully I've helped you at least in the slightest bit.

Yeah, I mean, he can definitely set up some of his own fights, especially in mid-game isolation as people rotate between lanes, but just in terms of a lot of trying to help your team if they group up, it can be kinda rough if they are behind.

> [{quoted}](name=Arveanor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9iEfhAEB,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-02-17T18:00:11.894+0000)

Thats part of being an assassin right? Some counter-play and un-reliability to go with a strong kit? I guess he is a healthy assassin and maybe we just arent used to that. When I get rolling, it is hard to stop. If I dont, Im just kinda there trying to do my best. If you dont make some good stuff happen (good farm or ganks) level 4-8 then its gonna be a tough ride.

See, I don't think unreliability is meant to be part of the standard assassin kit.  If you are an assassin, in most cases, it's up to you to use your combo correctly for max damage, and if you do so, you will do a shit load of burst, and if you planned it correctly, you might even escape alive.

Kha'zix is naturally supposed to have unreliability be part of his design, almost like gnar, but to a lesser degree.  With kha you have a lot of neat mechanics and utility to complement your damage, but you also run the risk of losing out on damage potential due to isolation.  

The problem is, the way kha is tuned right now, with 500 isolation range and such a huge chunk of his lategame damage requiring isolation to unlock, if a game starts going late, and teams start grouping up, he will become irrelevant, even if he had gotten ahead earlier in the game (which, let's be real, it's not like he has an S tier early game)

Oh yeah that nerf should have been repealed, 500 is way too damn much range to make kha relevant in team fights. Thats not where he is supposed to shine though, he is meant to pick people off and clean up a team fight, whereas most assassins can take a priority target out and be home free, khazix has to take what he can get and hope for the best.
Sure, he would never necessarily shine in a team fight, but with 500 range he just feels like he can't team fight at all.

Kha'Zix is in a really bad spot right now, despite what Riot thinks. He absolutely is a liability because his damage is so gimped compared to everyone else's at the moment. Isolation range is literally a 1v1 situation where teammates/minions are not present within a 50 mile radius. That's, at least, what it feels like. 

I think their balance problems came in when they tried to make his R Evolve defensive, nerfed the cast time and then removed the damage reduction...without reverting the annoying 2 second cast time. He can't lane right now at all and jungling is basically down to the other jungler sniffing glue or being a poor jungler. 

Heck, I'd say Talon jungle has more capacity right now than Kha'Zix jungle mainly because Talon doesn't have nerfed damage values like Kha'Zix does, despite the weak initial clears. He's better at late game and actuall killing people like an assassin should. Kha'Zix really can't do anything like that anymore unless the other team is seriously uncoordinated beyond YoloQ levels.

They could just revert the isolation range nerf.

You know, so he can actually isolate people again.

He should be buffed. Where other assassins can delete enemies, he only has that luxury  if they aren't surrounded by enemies. The Isolation thing is a good concept, but instead of making him viable during a teamfight and stronger alone, he's now in the state of being an assassin who can't actually kill unless:
1. He's been stealing kills when he ganks.
2. The enemy wandered into the jungle with 3/4 HP so he gets the isolated bonus.

Yeah, for all the hypothetical builds I've run the numbers on (mostly early-mid game builds) Kha'Zix does less damage than a zed or talon etc with the same items, even if his q is evolved, and the target is isolated.  It's not by much that he loses out in this scenario, and he has the benefit of resets and a tiny cooldown on q, so I'm fine with his upfront burst being smaller, but the theory of kha'zix was always that he was this really strong assassin who was doubly terrifying when you were alone.  He no longer does that, he's now a support with no utility, and if you get isolated, he's a B tier assassin.

Something's got to be changed about how isolation is handled, because not only is the range huge on it, they've also shifted his damage so he is even more reliant on isolation than he used to be.

I tried to main Kha'Zix once but I ended up quitting on him after the third round of nerfs and buffs. His entire existence has been a roller-coaster of ups and downs I never wished to ride. Change might be good but Kha'Zix certainly does too much of it.

Kha'Zix needs a team revolving around Kha'Zix - he can carry.  Hard.  But it's all about getting champions into isolation.

Try going Kha'Zix with any massive, AoE power-house champs - champs like Annie and Malphite do wonders.  The reason for this is that you give the enemy team an ultimatum - either you group up and get nuked by all the AoE, or you spread out and get slaughtered by Kha'Zix.  Mind, this isn't a foolproof method - you can still royally fuck up.  But I found that Kha does wonders on teams like this as AoE comps generally lack straight single-target power, which Kha'Zix brings the epitome.

Yeah, I think I would have to agree, and this is a very valid combination, or, even if you don't have a comp that's good at forcing people to spread out, if you play it smart, and have a co-ordinated team, you can try to play around map rotations and getting the enemy out of position to kill them in skirmishes, but that's hardly feasible to do with a soloqueue team.

How is he at splitpushing?  Seems like Isolation should make him a strong duelist and if you can repeatedly get two people to show up and then leap/stealth away alive, you've pretty much won (because your team is pushing 4v3 somewhere across the map).

> [{quoted}](name=Partholonian,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9iEfhAEB,comment-id=001200000000,timestamp=2015-02-18T03:42:18.096+0000)
>
> How is he at splitpushing?  Seems like Isolation should make him a strong duelist and if you can repeatedly get two people to show up and then leap/stealth away alive, you've pretty much won (because your team is pushing 4v3 somewhere across the map).

He's not bad at Splitpushing due to his escapes and good 1v1 potential, but his general item build doesn't contain much Attack Speed and then he needs to have had enough gold throughout the game for good Splitpushing items. In other words, Triforce/Hydra/BotRK are expensive items that Kha'Zix will need (mainly the first two, third one is not a normal buy) for splitpushing and that implies he does well enough prior to buy them.

I would argue tri force is also not a normal buy on kha'zix. It just has too many stats that he can't use as efficiently as your garden variety top lane bruiser.

Now, I'm not saying it's *bad* on kha'zix, but I think it is decidedly sub-optimal.

> [{quoted}](name=Arveanor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9iEfhAEB,comment-id=00120000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-18T06:19:35.996+0000)

I was actually being generous by referring to TriForce on Kha'Zam. When I mained him in S2 and S3, I scarcely bought it and if I did it was a last item when I was quite ahead of anything else. So basically Hydra is the only real buy you'd normally have on Kha'Zix, but even then it's expensive and gives no Attack Speed. In other words, he's only a possible splitpusher because of his mobility, not because of his tower killing capacity.
Yeah if i'm split pushing on kha'zix it's usually more of a desparate attempt to prevent the enemy team from grouping as 5 more than any actual desire to pick up free turrets.

> [{quoted}](name=Arveanor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9iEfhAEB,comment-id=0012000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-19T01:02:52.183+0000)
>
> Yeah if i'm split pushing on kha'zix it's usually more of a desparate attempt to prevent the enemy team from grouping as 5 more than any actual desire to pick up free turrets.

Exactly. If that's the reason you pick Kha'Zix too, then you're picking a subpar champ to do it. Rengar, Shaco (a good one), Talon and even Fizz do a better job at it than Kha'Zix right now. He might not be OP, but he's definitely not at average right now.
Anything with stealth can be powerful. That's mostly because low elo can't ward. However, higher elo the problem doesn't exist. Kha is assassin like bug, should be squishy.
Er, yes, he should be squishy, but I think you'll find a great deal of squishy champions in the league of legends who are considerably more viable.

As sad as it may sound Kha will never be buffed. When Kha was released he was powerful and did a job that no one else could, coming in wiping the enemy out and leaving with either reset E or damage reduction R. Now dont get me wrong 50% damage reduction is insane but Alistar now has a 70% damage reduction and Yi who is also an assassin has 50% at level 1 and a 70% at level 5 so i dont see why people and riot were so pissed about kha having a DR that lasted 1 to 2 seconds, so in the end they removed the R evolution bonus making it a worthless evolution. The point in this is Kha players are the only ones who like Kha everyone else hates him and the assholes who play this game will always complain but people are dead set on Kha never being just strong enough. Heres 2 of 3 things that needs to happen.
1 Reduce the iso range its too damn long turrents can stay allies but the iso range is impossible to get now
2 Make R do something again cause its worthless as an evo which is sad cause whn it is evolved it makes kha look so good
3 Give Kha some way to force isolation onto someone
4 Make his passive scale with his ad which in turn would make him more burst and people would use his ult more
But if these seem to broken for the bug then i dont know what to do about him anymore cause I really love playing as him.
I think one of those suggestions on it's own would work fine, although the ad scaling on passive would have to be pretty small.
Of course I don't want Kha to be broken i just want him to be balanced and to have a real reason to think about what im evolving. Anyways I say make the scaling about .5 maybe

the .5 ad would be a pretty big strong buff and I doubt most people would consider it balanced. Personally I think his buffs should be more focused around changing his q's range or something, b/c the passive buff is just boring to me :p
Hmmm you have a point there maybe a new passive altogether is whats needed like something that forces isolation or something?

I've heard a lot of pretty valid arguments against forcing isolation on targets. Unless it was pretty highly situational, I think it would be problematic because for most people, when playing kha'zix they think "If I stay near allies, I am safe[ish]" but by giving kha'zix a reliable way to force isolation, it kinda eliminates that point.

I think the only way they could let him force isolation is if it was on a big tradeoff that would limit his effectiveness otherwise.  Like if his W evo lost its slow and gained the isolation force, that **might** work, idk, hard to call that one imo.

Does Nocturne's ult apply isolation? If not, it should.

Or Grave's Smoke Thingy.

Basically make it so anything that removes ally vision will proc (however briefly) isolation. Indirect buff by promoting synergy?
Well what if they made Kha's Isolation range sort of a Tier buff. like it's still 500 range, but it's got several tiers, and each Tier of isolation means more damage for kha'zix

R evolution is still viable against teams with mostly targeted damage, the extra stealth is helpful in team fights absent pinks for removing AA aggro, and for re positioning with no resets. i used to dismiss the idea entirely, but one game i accidentally double-clicked leveling R and had great success with it. 

the main benefit is that i can use the first cast + evolved E to close the gap of anyone within sight and still have 2 (lengthy) casts to aid an escape after chunking a second  or third target that i cant finish off without dying

also, worth noting. i like that kha's passive scales with AP along with his W heal... this makes the AP on hex-tech revolver almost offset the  (wasted stats/spellvamp Q benifit) ratio. not an item that i build often, but when im ahead already and just want to streamroll the game drain-tanking it can be useful

true but most people dont see it that way because it does nothing and therefore gets no attention really i see people use it sometimes but still i feel it should have some incentive to why you should get it
